com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenObjectImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectShapeBase
        • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectShape
          • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectImage

  • public final class SpenObjectImage
extends SpenObjectShape
    SpenObjectImage Class.
    ObjectImage has the basic object properties by inherit the SpenObjectShape,
    and has additional functions for image objects.
    Some APIs and variables are moved or integrated to super class SpenObjectShape since 4.0.0.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      void setTransparency(boolean transparency)
      Enable or disable transparency for the image.
      If transparency is enabled, the transparent area of the image should be ignored when you call the SpenPageDoc.findObject~ methods.
      If transparency is not enabled, the SpenPageDoc.findObject~ methods should consider the entire area of image to be opaque.

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(Bitmap image)
        Set the specified image.
        In 3.x version, when this is called, flip information should be removed.
        But as of 4.0 version, when this is called, flip information should be kept.
        So, if object is already flipped, the image should be displayed with flip.
        After 4.0.0, the image is integrated with the fill effect of the SpenObjectShape.
        It means if you set the image by this API, SDK set the SpenFillImageEffect internally.
        Parameters:
        image - The bitmap. if the bitmap is NULL, initialize.
        ObjectImage saves the bitmap as an image file internally, If you do not need the bitmap anymore, the bitmap.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the image is recycled.
        OutOfMemoryError - Thrown if not enough memory to create compress bitmap.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setImage

        public void setImage(String filePath)
        Set the image from the specified file.
        In 3.x version, when this is called, flip information should be removed.
        But as of 4.0 version, when this is called, flip information should be kept.
        So, if object is already flipped, the image should be displayed with flip.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The image file path.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if filePath is invalid or null.
        OutOfMemoryError - Thrown if not enough memory to create compress bitmap.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setImage

        public void setImage(Bitmap image,
            Rect ninePatchRect)
        Set the specified image with the specified nine patch rectangle.
        If crop information is already set, ignore the specified nine patch rectangle.
        To apply the specified nine patch, remove the crop information.

        In 3.x version, when this is called, flip information should be removed.
        But as of 4.0 version, when this is called, flip information should be kept.
        So, if object is already flipped, the image should be displayed with flip.
        Parameters:
        image - The bitmap image.
        ninePatchRect - The center rectangle of the nine patch.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the image is recycled.
        OutOfMemoryError - Thrown if not enough memory to create compress bitmap.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setImage(Bitmap), setCropRect(Rect)

      • setImage

        public void setImage(String filePath,
            Rect ninePatchRect)
        Set the image from the specified file with the specified nine patch rectangle.
        If crop information is already set, ignore the specified nine patch rectangle.
        To apply the specified nine patch, remove the crop information.

        In 3.x version, when this is called, flip information should be removed.
        But as of 4.0 version, when this is called, flip information should be kept.
        So, if object is already flipped, the image should be displayed with flip.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path of the image file.
        ninePatchRect - The center rectangle of the nine patch.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the filePath is invalid.
        OutOfMemoryError - Thrown if not enough memory to create compress bitmap.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setRect

        public void setRect(RectF rect,
           boolean regionOnly)
        Set the specified rectangle of the region.
        ObjectImage forwards the regionOnly parameter to ObjectBase.
        Overrides:
        setRect in class SpenObjectBase
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle of region.
        regionOnly - Set to true to not allow the internal data to be changed, set to false to let rectangle change the internal data.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setImageBorder

        public void setImageBorder(Bitmap image,
                  Rect ninePatchRect)
        Deprecated. As of 4.0.0, do not support.
        Set the specified image border with the specified nine patch rectangle.
        If this method is called, the border type is set to "BORDER_TYPE_IMAGE".
        Parameters:
        image - The image border bitmap.
        ninePatchRect - The center rectangle of the nine patch.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the image passed is a recycled image.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        getImageBorderPath(), getImageBorderNinePatchRect()

      • setCropRect

        public void setCropRect(Rect cropRect)
        Deprecated. As of 4.0.0, do not support anymore.
        Set the image crop cropRect information.
        If you reset the crop information, an empty rectangle (left >= right or top >= bottom) is set.
        If crop information is set, ignore the nine patch information.
        Parameters:
        cropRect - The rectangle to be cropped.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • getCropRect

        public Rect getCropRect()
        Deprecated. As of 4.0.0, do not support anymore.
        Get the crop rectangle information.
        The default value is an empty rectangle (left >= right or top >= bottom).
        Returns:
        The crop rectangle.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setTransparency

        public void setTransparency(boolean transparency)
        Enable or disable transparency for the image.
        If transparency is enabled, the transparent area of the image should be ignored when you call the SpenPageDoc.findObject~ methods.
        If transparency is not enabled, the SpenPageDoc.findObject~ methods should consider the entire area of image to be opaque.
        Parameters:
        transparency - Set to true to enable transparency for the image.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        SpenPageDoc.findObjectAtPosition(int, float, float), SpenPageDoc.findObjectInClosedCurve(int, PointF[]), SpenPageDoc.findObjectInRect(int, RectF, boolean)

      • getTransparency

        public boolean getTransparency()
        Check if transparency is enabled for the image.
        Returns:
        if true, transparency is enabled for the image.
        For more detail information, please refer to setTransparency(boolean)
        Since:
        3.0.0

        Check if the object is changed.
        The changed flag is set when object data is changed using the API.
        If this object is saved by SpenPageDoc, clear the flag.
        Overrides:
        isChanged in class SpenObjectBase
        Returns:
        true if object data is changed or created. Otherwise false.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • getDrawnRect

        public RectF getDrawnRect()
        Description copied from class: SpenObjectBase
        Get the region that the rectangle takes up in the viewport. If an object got rectangle(1, 1, 2, 4) is rotated by 90 degrees using setRotate(90), rectangle is still (1, 1, 2, 4) but DrawnRect is (0, 2, 3, 3).
        Overrides:
        getDrawnRect in class SpenObjectBase
        Returns:
        The viewing object area.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        SpenObjectBase.getRect()

      • copy

        public void copy(SpenObjectBase source)
        Copy data from the Image object. Exceptionally, connected object list information is not copied.
        Overrides:
        copy in class SpenObjectShapeBase
        Parameters:
        source - The source object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if class type is different. Or if source is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        SpenObjectShapeBase.copy(SpenObjectBase)
